topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny opens with Figma’s controversial early vision (multiplayer design) and introduces the show and guest Yuhki Yamashita, outlining his background and what the episode will cover.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Notion (team collaboration workspace) and Vanta (SOC 2/security compliance automation).

topics.title: Yuhki’s career arc to Figma CPO
topics.summary: Yuhki walks through his path from Microsoft (Hotmail/Windows) to YouTube, then Uber, including how he first encountered Figma and why the mission drew him in.

topics.title: Switching from PM to design and back
topics.summary: They discuss Yuhki’s move into design leadership at Uber, what PMs can learn from doing design work, and why managing designers can be uniquely challenging.

topics.title: Storytelling as a core PM leadership skill
topics.summary: Yuhki explains why storytelling is central to PM success: synthesis, creating memorable “memes,” and driving action across distracted organizations.

topics.title: How to improve storytelling in practice
topics.summary: They get tactical on leveling up storytelling: resetting context to avoid the curse of knowledge, and learning clarity through teaching and metaphors.

topics.title: PMs owning the “why” and five whys
topics.summary: Yuhki argues PMs don’t need to own the idea, but must own the “why” so teams can make good local decisions; they also discuss Figma’s use of “five whys” in engineering postmortems and retros.

topics.title: Customer proximity and community-driven feedback loops
topics.summary: Yuhki describes Figma’s origin in tight designer feedback cycles, ongoing community listening (including Twitter), and how they balance loud voices with research/data.

topics.title: Working with Dylan Field and customer obsession
topics.summary: Yuhki shares what it’s like partnering with Dylan—intuition shaped by massive customer exposure—and a story illustrating Dylan’s deep, real-time curiosity about user pain points.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Ad read conversation about Flatfile and the importance of reliable CSV import/data onboarding for B2B SaaS retention and conversion.

topics.title: When great products miss: branching and merging adoption
topics.summary: Yuhki discusses a major feature (branching/merging for design systems) that initially underperformed, and how building for larger orgs challenges Figma’s dogfooding and validation approach.

topics.title: How Figma maintains high product quality
topics.summary: They cover dogfooding at scale—shifting internal workflows to Figma/FigJam (decks, performance calibration templates)—and how personal accountability to users drives quality (with Uber parallels).

topics.title: Bottom-up fixes, developer motivation, and OKR struggles
topics.summary: Yuhki explains why he protects bottom-up energy for fixing issues, then dives into his love-hate relationship with OKRs: meaningless proxy metrics vs. uncontrollable business metrics, iterations from OKRs to “commitments,” and principles like legibility and actionability.
